message:
Shibir out for hartal for 3rd day: demo in 535 places, nabbed 45, injured 65

No unitary election in Bangladesh- Chhatrashibir


Bangladesh Islami Chhatrashibir brought out processions and held protest gatherings across the country with an aim to effectualize today’s hartal as a part of the ceaseless 84-hour shutdown called by the 18-party alliance. Processions were launched in as many as 535 places countrywide including 45 alone in the capital. Cops as well as goons of Awami League, Jubo League and Chhatra League opened fire at the protesters and picketers while holding peaceful demos and gatherings whereby 65 Shibir men got injured. The police unjustly apprehended 45 Shibir men today.

Shibir leaders said while addressing post-demo gatherings in different places and points of the country, “The Awami government is being detached from the masses due to its massive corruption and conspiracies against Islam and the nation. This is why they are daydreaming to hang on power by holding a sham election under the pro-party interim government system and ergo they have scrapped the non-party caretaker government system. The cancellation of Jamaat’s registration has deepened the crisis in national politics. The student segment is always against such autocratic actions of the government and detached the capital city from the rest of the country by effectualizing ceaseless shutdowns. We’d like to clearly say that no election under party government shall be allowed to take place in the country.”
